trans-unit.source: Provides data for the `Scroll` event.
The `Scroll` event occurs when the user changes the value of the scroll bar.
This event can result from a variety of actions, such as clicking a scroll bar arrow, pressing the UP ARROW or DOWN ARROW, or dragging the scroll box.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs> specifies the type of scroll event that occurred and the new value of the scroll bar.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.ScrollOrientation%2A> property to determine the scroll bar orientation for the `Scroll` event.

The `Scroll` event occurs for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> controls.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs"></xref> class using the given values for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.Type"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.NewValue"></xref> properties.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventType"></xref> values.
The new value for the scroll bar.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs"></xref> class using the given values for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.Type"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.OldValue"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.NewValue"></xref> properties.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventType"></xref> values.
The old value for the scroll bar.
The new value for the scroll bar.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs"></xref> class using the given values for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.Type"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.NewValue"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.ScrollOrientation"></xref> properties.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventType"></xref> values.
The new value for the scroll bar.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollOrientation"></xref> values.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs"></xref> class using the given values for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.Type"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.OldValue"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.NewValue"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.ScrollOrientation"></xref> properties.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventType"></xref> values.
The old value for the scroll bar.
The new value for the scroll bar.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollOrientation"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Value"></xref> of the scroll bar.
The numeric value that the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Value"></xref> property will be changed to.
Gets the old <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Value"></xref> of the scroll bar.
The numeric value that the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar.Value"></xref> property contained before it changed.
Gets the scroll bar orientation that raised the `Scroll` event.

You would typically use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.ScrollOrientation%2A> property to determine the scroll bar orientation that raised the `Scroll` event, such as with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.Scroll?displayProperty=fullName> event.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollOrientation"></xref> values.
Gets the type of scroll event that occurred.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventType"></xref> values.
